Description: Limestone fragment: incised with parts of the name and titulary of Horemheb and epithets. The stone is slightly circular and may be part of a pillar base. The piece is worn in places and heavily pitted. There are no traces of colour.
Curator's comments: Companion fragments: 1927,1011.2 and 1927,1011.4. Two other fragments, 1927,1011.15.5 and 1927,1011.15.3, appear in the register but cannot at present be traced. Together with 1927,1011.15.1 they are listed in Pendlebury, 'City of Akhenaten' III, 12, nos. 26/s 24, 30, 114-17 as belonging to the same monument. However, these fragments are quite distinct in style and material from 1927,1011.15. 1. They may all belong to one monument or several. Bibliography: J. Pendlebury, 'City of Akhenaten' III (London, 1951), 12. nos. 26/s 30. 114-17.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.1)
Condition: Fair (incomplete). The piece is worn in places and heavily pitted.
